entry.title: [WW] I've got COVID, which sucks. I went over two years without catching it even when
entry.content:
I've got COVID, which sucks. I went over two years without catching it even when living in the same flat as someone who had it. The first day was Monday, which was really bad. Couldn't sleep, couldn't really do anything but lie on the sofa and suffer.
It's also hitting me at a particularly rough time in terms of mood. It's been up and down the past few months, but now it's really down. Everything seems so miserable and pointless. All my thoughts are wholly negative. It's not that I can't appreciate that these thoughts are irrational, they are. But I still can't get them out of my head, even with my usual distractions.
Not really looking for advice because I wouldn't make good use of it anyway. I don't know what I'm looking for or what I want, because it feels totally impossible to be happy at this point.
